text: it was really in 2016 that we made our
big strategic decision the first thing
we did was we said would be a cloud
first company the second thing that we
did was that we said would shut down our
mega datacenters which was a big call
for us because we've got big sensors in
the US the UK and Europe and then would
underpin that all with digital
foundations program we've sought to
modernize the landscape as part for
migration we have moved away from
proprietary legacy databases onto Sapa
SC and Hana databases we've Trotta
really maximized the potential the a
diverse environment gives to us which is
we don't have to have spare capacity
sitting around for those moments during
an annual business cycle that need
higher levels of compute we recently
just moved a 16 terabyte
system to a large SOP system that runs
our fuels business so customer fuel
supply this is a business that runs a 24
by 7 so they can't afford to disrupt it
because you disrupt the fuel supplied
end-to-end across the company
what we did is had a 60 hour window then
during the migration we actually used
the power of AWS to accelerate it one of
those things that AWS has been really
good at working with us on is is helping
us develop develop training programs
helping come in with their professional
services teams to support our engineers
and developed in their skills we've just
recently announced this week that we're
all-in with AWS as our partner to exit
our European mega datacenters and we're
gonna be partnering with AWS here to
